title: Miley Cyrus Bangerz throwback to mark six years since album released
text:
She’s just being Miley (Picture: Getty/RCA Records)

Miley Cyrus is ringing in the sixth birthday of her iconic album Bangerz and we have a feeling we might be seeing the old Miley return any day soon…

Breaking her silence after hitting out at slut shamers criticising her public relationships, the singer posted a series of pictures and videos harking back to 2013 to celebrate the sixth anniversary of Bangerz’ release.

Featuring the hit singles We Can’t Stop and Wrecking Ball, the album saw Miley finally manage to drop the Disney label and bring in a new, sexy image – with the incredible bleach blonde short haircut – and new era of music.

‘Bangerz is 6 years old,’ the 26-year-old singer wrote on Instagram, ‘Wasn’t even 21 when I dropped this record ! Couldn’t drink but f***kkkk I partied!’

Now there’s the Miley we know and love.

Captioning the other posts: ‘6 years ago my life changed forever’ and ‘Happy 6 year anniversary #Bangerz !!!! Here’s to 6 more years of p***ing people off,’ it seems clear that Miley could be making a return to her former ‘bad girl’ image and we’re definitely here for it.

‘I never thought they’d talk for 6 years ….. #F***inBangerz#YouStillTalkin,’ Miley wrote on one post, seemingly referencing the recent stories that had emerged after she was seen kissing fellow musician Cody Simpson this week.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Miley’s love life has gained a lot of public attention following her split from her husband of less than a year Liam Hemsworth, following ten years of dating.

Immediately after the announcement Miley was spotted smooching Brody Jenner’s recent ex Kaitlynn Carter, with the pair reported to have ‘split’ a month later.

But after a fan photographed Miley kissing 22-year-old singer Cody during a date, the singer revealed that she’d had had enough of staying silent.

‘Can a girl not get a f**king acai bowl and a morning make-out session in peace?’ she wrote on her Instagram Stories before schooling everyone on her thoughts on the matter in a lengthy text post.

‘I know the public feels invested in my past relationship because they felt like they saw it thru from the beginning,’ she began.

‘But I am grown now and make choices as an adult know the truth/details/reality.’

The singer also addressed the double standards in the entertainment industry towards women and men dating, stating her male counterparts rarely get ‘slut-shamed’ for their actions, while women are slated for moving on from a relationship quickly.

You go girl!

description: Miley Cyrus is ringing in the sixth birthday of her iconic album Bangerz and we have a feeling we might be seeing the old Miley return any day soon.
